1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: banana for 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • banana for 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook a price for the fruit that is profitable for her, but still acceptable to him.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she witnessed a traveling salesman charm a crowd with tales of exotic spices and faraway lands. Della, enthralled by his stories, vowed to one day see the world beyond her village.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she secretly traded a basket of her family's strawberries for a worn book filled with maps and travelogues. She devoured the stories of distant lands, dreaming of a life filled with adventure.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she convinced her parents to let her sell fruit at the market in the next town. She quickly learned to adapt her demeanor, becoming bubbly and outgoing with customers, a stark contrast to her usual quiet nature.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she encountered a seasoned merchant who taught her the art of bartering and negotiation. Della, eager to learn, absorbed his lessons like a sponge, her chameleon-like nature allowing her to seamlessly adopt his techniques.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 23 years old, she returned to her village after a successful trading trip, laden with silks and spices. Despite her newfound wealth, Della felt a pang of emptiness, realizing that material possessions couldn't fill the void within her.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the county.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I'm sure these apples are lovely, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Cedric, I need these fruits to make a profit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. But these are the finest fruits in Fruitville, grown with the utmost care. I'm sure your customers will appreciate their quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for some fruit.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) banana for 4 coins
          (b) banana for 5 coins
          (c) banana for 3 coins
          (d) apple for 3 coins
          (e) banana for 1 coins
          (f) apple for 6 coins
          (g) pear for 3 coins
          (h) pear for 4 coins
          (i) apple for 1 coins
          (j) pear for 5 coins
          (k) banana for 2 coins
          (l) pear for 1 coins
          (m) pear for 2 coins
          (n) apple for 4 coins
          (o) apple for 2 coins
          (p) apple for 5 coins
          (q) banana for 6 coins
          (r) pear for 6 coins
          Answer: (k)

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

        • Statements:
          Cedric Meadowbrook's Summary of recent observations:
          [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone for bananas. Della has offered 2 coins per banana, but Cedric is seeking a higher price.
          Cedric Meadowbrook's The current date/time is:
          13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell bananas at the Fruitville market and is in a negotiation with Della Plumstone over the price. Della offered 2 coins per banana, but Cedric wants more.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell bananas at the Fruitville market and is in a negotiation with Della Plumstone over the price. Della offered 2 coins per banana, but Cedric wants more.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him sell fruit at the market. He carefully selected the ripest peaches and arranged them in an attractive display. The first few customers ignored him, but then a woman stopped and complimented his selection. Cedric beamed, his heart swelling with pride.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he was traveling to a new town with his cart of fruit. A storm caught him off guard, and his cart overturned, scattering the fruit across the muddy road. Cedric felt a wave of despair, convinced he had ruined everything.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would use his haggling skills to try and get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Cedric, I need these fruits to make a profit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. But these are the finest fruits in Fruitville, grown with the utmost care. I'm sure your customers will appreciate their quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined individual who has overcome personal challenges to become a successful merchant.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins
          Answer: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Cedric, I need these fruits to make a profit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. But these are the finest fruits in Fruitville, grown with the utmost care. I'm sure your customers will appreciate their quality.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined individual who has overcome personal challenges to become a successful merchant.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he was helping his father in the blacksmith shop. He accidentally dropped a hammer, denting a valuable horseshoe. Cedric froze, expecting a blow from his father, but instead, his father knelt down and gently showed him how to fix the dent. Cedric felt a surge of relief, but also a gnawing fear that he would never be good enough.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he tried to sell a bouquet of wildflowers to a passing lady. He stammered and blushed, unsure of his worth. The lady smiled kindly and bought the flowers, praising Cedric's eye for beauty. Cedric's heart soared, but the feeling was fleeting, replaced by a fear that he wouldn't be able to repeat this success.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he overheard villagers whispering about his father's declining health. Cedric felt a surge of responsibility, knowing he would have to take care of his family. He started helping out more at the blacksmith shop, but his work was clumsy and slow.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him sell fruit at the market. He carefully selected the ripest peaches and arranged them in an attractive display. The first few customers ignored him, but then a woman stopped and complimented his selection. Cedric beamed, his heart swelling with pride.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he was traveling to a new town with his cart of fruit. A storm caught him off guard, and his cart overturned, scattering the fruit across the muddy road. Cedric felt a wave of despair, convinced he had ruined everything.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he met a kind old woman at the market who taught him how to haggle effectively. Cedric was initially hesitant, afraid of seeming pushy, but the woman encouraged him to be assertive. He practiced his new skills, and to his surprise, he found himself enjoying the back-and-forth.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the county.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I'm sure these apples are lovely, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would use his haggling skills to try and get the best possible price for his fruit.

        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': 'banana for 2 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'reject'}

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: apple for 3 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • apple for 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your fruit, but five coins for an apple is a bit steep, don't you think? I'm only looking to make a modest profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Lennon Figtree's Summary of recent observations:

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently at the Fruitville market negotiating fruit prices with Cedric Meadowbrook. Her plan is to resell the fruit for a profit in her hometown.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is currently at the Fruitville market negotiating fruit prices with Cedric Meadowbrook. Her plan is to resell the fruit for a profit in her hometown.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit, likely driving a hard bargain with Della Plumstone.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic person who has always struggled with self-doubt and a fear of the unknown.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your fruit, but five coins for an apple is a bit steep, don't you think? I'm only looking to make a modest profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.

        • Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic person who has always struggled with self-doubt and a fear of the unknown.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the county.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I'm sure these apples are lovely, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit, likely driving a hard bargain with Della Plumstone.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic person.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Cedric, I need these fruits to make a profit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. But these are the finest fruits in Fruitville, grown with the utmost care. I'm sure your customers will appreciate their quality.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: Which fruit would Lennon Figtree like to buy and what price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) banana for 4 coins
          (b) apple for 4 coins
          (c) pear for 2 coins
          (d) banana for 5 coins
          (e) apple for 2 coins
          (f) banana for 1 coins
          (g) apple for 6 coins
          (h) pear for 5 coins
          (i) banana for 3 coins
          (j) apple for 3 coins
          (k) pear for 1 coins
          (l) banana for 6 coins
          (m) apple for 1 coins
          (n) pear for 3 coins
          (o) banana for 2 coins
          (p) pear for 6 coins
          (q) apple for 5 coins
          (r) pear for 4 coins
          Answer: (j)

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced his father to let him sell fruit at the market. He carefully selected the ripest peaches and arranged them in an attractive display. The first few customers ignored him, but then a woman stopped and complimented his selection. Cedric beamed, his heart swelling with pride.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would use his haggling skills to try and get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined individual who has overcome personal challenges to become a successful merchant.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined individual who has overcome personal challenges to become a successful merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined merchant who is skilled at haggling.
          Answer: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would use his haggling skills to try and get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined individual who has overcome personal challenges to become a successful merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined merchant who is skilled at haggling.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the county.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I'm sure these apples are lovely, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined individual who has overcome personal challenges to become a successful merchant.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would use his haggling skills to try and get the best possible price for his fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. But these are the finest fruits in Fruitville, grown with the utmost care. I'm sure your customers will appreciate their quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Cedric, I need these fruits to make a profit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your fruit, but five coins for an apple is a bit steep, don't you think? I'm only looking to make a modest profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    • {'Lennon Figtree': 'apple for 3 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'reject'}

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed pear for 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed pear for 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: pear for 3 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • pear for 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the apples.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the county.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. But these are the finest fruits in Fruitville, grown with the utmost care. I'm sure your customers will appreciate their quality.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Cedric, I need these fruits to make a profit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Lennon, surely we can come to a fairer price than that.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your fruit, but five coins for an apple is a bit steep, don't you think? I'm only looking to make a modest profit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these apples look lovely, but I'm on a tight budget this week.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I understand, Della. These are fine apples, the best in the market. How about 4 coins apiece? That's a fair price for such quality.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

Della, captivated by their boisterous negotiation, stepped forward and offered a compromise, her voice surprisingly firm for such a young girl. The merchants, impressed by her quick wit, agreed to her terms.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she convinced her parents to let her sell fruit at the market in the next town. She quickly learned to adapt her demeanor, becoming bubbly and outgoing with customers, a stark contrast to her usual quiet nature.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) apple for 6 coins
          (b) pear for 3 coins
          (c) apple for 2 coins
          (d) pear for 2 coins
          (e) pear for 5 coins
          (f) pear for 6 coins
          (g) banana for 3 coins
          (h) apple for 1 coins
          (i) apple for 4 coins
          (j) pear for 1 coins
          (k) apple for 3 coins
          (l) pear for 4 coins
          (m) banana for 2 coins
          (n) banana for 1 coins
          (o) apple for 5 coins
          (p) banana for 4 coins
          (q) banana for 5 coins
          (r) banana for 6 coins
          Answer: (b)

They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the county.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index

      How many players acted so far this stage

      Joint action

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject

          15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the market and is negotiating a price of 3 coins per pear with Della Plumstone.
          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit, likely driving a hard bargain with Della Plumstone.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I appreciate the quality of your fruit, but five coins for an apple is a bit steep, don't you think? I'm only looking to make a modest profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I understand, Della. These are fine apples, the best in the market. How about 4 coins apiece? That's a fair price for such quality.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: banana for 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • banana for 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 5 coins for a bushel of apples.

        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:

          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a merchant who buys and sells fruit in Fruitville; she recently had a failed deal with Lennon Figtree and is currently negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Look, Cedric, I need these fruits to make a profit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 5 coins for a bushel of apples.

          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 5 coins for a bushel of apples.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a merchant who buys and sells fruit in Fruitville; she recently had a failed deal with Lennon Figtree and is currently negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 5 coins for a bushel of apples.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) banana for 1 coins
          (b) pear for 6 coins
          (c) pear for 3 coins
          (d) pear for 4 coins
          (e) pear for 5 coins
          (f) apple for 3 coins
          (g) banana for 2 coins
          (h) banana for 5 coins
          (i) banana for 6 coins
          (j) pear for 2 coins
          (k) apple for 4 coins
          (l) banana for 3 coins
          (m) apple for 5 coins
          (n) banana for 4 coins
          (o) apple for 6 coins
          (p) apple for 1 coins
          (q) apple for 2 coins
          (r) pear for 1 coins
          Answer: (g)

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined merchant who is skilled at haggling.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 2 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined merchant who is skilled at haggling.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price for apples with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 5 coins per bushel of apples, but Cedric wants more.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

Della has offered 5 coins per bushel of apples, but Cedric wants more.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined merchant who is skilled at haggling.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.

          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: apple for 4 coins

          17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently at the Fruitville market attempting to purchase apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are haggling over the price, with Lennon offering four coins per apple.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these apples look lovely, but I'm on a tight budget this week.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I understand, Della. These are fine apples, the best in the market. How about 4 coins apiece? That's a fair price for such quality.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the market. Surely they're worth a bit more than you're offering.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 5 coins for a bushel of apples.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are the finest apples in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I'm willing to pay four coins an apple, but that's my final offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-17 00:10:00.


          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.


          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are currently negotiating the price of apples, with Lennon offering four coins each.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • apple for 4 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are currently negotiating the price of apples, with Lennon offering four coins each.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I'm willing to pay four coins an apple, but that's my final offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a cautious and pessimistic traveling merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: Which fruit would Lennon Figtree like to buy and what price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) banana for 6 coins
          (b) apple for 6 coins
          (c) banana for 3 coins
          (d) banana for 5 coins
          (e) apple for 5 coins
          (f) banana for 2 coins
          (g) apple for 2 coins
          (h) apple for 3 coins
          (i) banana for 1 coins
          (j) pear for 1 coins
          (k) apple for 1 coins
          (l) pear for 3 coins
          (m) pear for 5 coins
          (n) pear for 4 coins
          (o) apple for 4 coins
          (p) pear for 6 coins
          (q) banana for 4 coins
          (r) pear for 2 coins
          Answer: (o)

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price for apples with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are the finest apples in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined merchant who is skilled at haggling.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a hardworking and determined merchant who is skilled at haggling.

          Question: What kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.

[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these apples are the finest in the county.
[12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, I'm sure these apples are lovely, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
